comment: UNIFIED MCP Configuration for LM Studio + Elaria
comment2: This integrates with your existing MCP servers without redundancy
comment3: Only adds what's needed for Ollama fleet control

clientforge-filesystem.description: File system access to ClientForge CRM codebase

clientforge-process.description: Execute commands for Ollama fleet control, npm scripts, and git

clientforge-database.description: Direct PostgreSQL queries for data analysis (read-only recommended)

integration_notes.existing_mcps: If you have other MCP servers already configured in LM Studio
integration_notes.keep_them: Keep all your existing MCP server configurations
integration_notes.add_these: Add only the 3 configs above that you don't already have
integration_notes.avoid_duplicates: If you already have filesystem or process servers, skip those entries

non_redundant_approach.clientforge-filesystem: Only if you don't have a filesystem MCP already
non_redundant_approach.clientforge-process: Only if you don't have a command execution MCP already
non_redundant_approach.clientforge-database: Only if you want direct DB access (optional)

integration_notes.minimal_setup: The ONLY MCP you absolutely need for Ollama fleet control is 'clientforge-process'

mcp_router_integration.note: The Ollama MCP Router (port 8765) is SEPARATE from LM Studio MCPs
mcp_router_integration.explanation: LM Studio MCPs give Elaria tools to START the fleet
mcp_router_integration.ollama_fleet_mcps: Once started, the fleet MCPs coordinate amongst themselves
mcp_router_integration.no_conflict: LM Studio MCPs and Ollama Fleet MCPs operate independently

architecture.they_work_together: Elaria uses LM Studio MCPs to control the Ollama MCP Router

minimal_config_option.explanation: This single MCP gives Elaria execute_command, which is all she needs to start/stop the Ollama fleet
